inn1.comm: fullish on off stump, a little bit of swing away, and he gets on the front foot to defend back to the bowler
nice line again, angling in and straightening from a fairly full length on off stump. Blocked back to the bowler
shorter now, excellent carry through to the keeper, but he's slid this a considerable distance down the leg side
full again, on a fourth-stump line, a bit of swing away, and he looks to push that through cover point and gets a thickish outside edge to third man
length ball, angling towards off stump. Amla defends off the back foot
in the blockhole, a bit of late swing in towards off stump. Amla jabs it away to the left of mid-off

beauty. That was just a touch back of a length, and de Kock was caught not moving his feet. He played away from his body, looking for away swing. It came back in a touch and went through the gate and over the top of the stumps
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away towards short midwicket
length ball, a bit of swing into the left-hander and it hits him on the pad as he looks to work it into the leg side. Started outside leg stump, swinging further down, barely any appeal
shortish ball outside off. Amla stands tall and slaps it to point
angles it into the pads now and Amla plays an interesting shot to pick up four, doesn't close his face on the ball but scoops it over midwicket with a straight bat
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Amla defends off the back foot
back of a length, too straight, and he shuffles across to flick it off his hips to the left of the man at long leg
back of a length on middle stump, a bit of extra bounce, and de Kock takes his bottom hand off the bat handle as he defends off the back foot
fuller now, a bit of shape towards off stump, and he's halfway forward to defend towards mid-on
back of a length, moving away a hint from off stump. De Kock defends into the covers off the back foot
on the pads now and he clips it away off his hips, past the diving man at square leg
length ball outside off, de Kock plays a checked drive to mid-off
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. He gets on his toes and defends towards point
back of a length on off stump. Defended off the back foot towards short cover
goes a little wider on the crease and angles it in towards off stump. Amla looks to work it with the angle into the leg side, plays it to mid-on
bouncer now, and Amla shapes to pull but chooses to duck in the end. Too high for him to play a shot, and the umpire signals wide
back of a length, nips back in a touch towards off and middle. Amla defends into the off side, bat close to his body
yorker now, on middle and leg, and there's a loud appeal from the bowler for lbw. Amla jammed his bat down on the ball and just about managed an inside-edge onto pad, runs down to fine leg
short now, not too much width, but just enough for Amla to draw himself up to his full height and lash that away to the right of backward point. Superb use of the wrists there.
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, blocked towards point
shortish, wide outside off. De Kock throws his bat at it and the thick edge flies in the air but drops well short of third man
a lot of width but it seems a little harsh to call that wide. Well inside the tramline and Amla went hard at it and was beaten by his own lack of footwork and maybe some extra bounce
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot towards mid-on
short and wide again and Amla chases at it and misses. Once again, it's called wide. The keeper and the slips went up for a catch, but I don't think there was any contact
back of a length outside off stump, and Amla uses the angle to make himself a tiny bit of width and punches the ball through the gap between short cover and mid-off. Super shot
back of a length, angling away outside off stump. Amla lets it go
digs it in short. Amla leans away and lets it go
again it's short and Amla looks for the uppercut but can't connect. Again, Wade and Watson go up for a catch, but the bat seemed a long way away from the ball
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. He shuffles across and tucks it away towards midwicket
shortish ball, rising over off stump. Amla hops to play that down towards midwicket

gone! It's a short ball, quite pullable, but Amla doesn't quite make the best possible contact. He's into the shot too early and it's off the bottom of the bat and straight to a squarish short midwicket, where Cummins takes a good low catch.
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot towards short cover.
a little fuller than the previous one. Faf jumps back and across and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in towards leg stump, clipped away past short midwicket, to the right of mid-on
starts off by slanting one quite a way down the leg side. Faf can't connect with that attempted glance
back of a length on a fifth-stump line. Left alone
back of a length on off stump. He goes back to defend and ends up popping it in the air, down the ground, but it's too far to the right of Cummins for him to make an attempt to catch it
back of a length on off stump, blocked off the back foot, down the pitch
shortish on off stump. He goes for the pull but it doesn't quite rise and he gets a bottom edge onto his right thigh
a little fuller now, outside off, and he goes back and across to defend
short outside off. He looks to flay it away through the off side without moving his feet too much, and doesn't connect
full on off stump, pushed towards mid-off
full and flat on middle stump, punched down the ground to long-on
a bit slower now, angled in towards middle and off, and he dives across to his right in his follow-through to stop that firm drive from de Kock
angled in, slightly round-arm, towards middle stump. De Kock defends into the off side, playing slightly inside-out

put down. It's tossed up outside off and he goes for the big, flat-batted drive, and the thick edge goes flying to Watson at slip, at head height. He throws his arms up, gets both hands to the ball, but it simply doesn't stick
back of a length on off and middle, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched down to mid-off
a bit fuller now, and he falls over a touch as he blocks this back to the bowler. Feet were a little late to move
not too short, but short enough for him to rock back and pull it from outside off down to the midwicket boundary
shortish, a bit of width outside off, but it doesn't quite come on. Looked to punch through the covers, ended up dragging it down towards mid-off
full and wide and he swings his arms through the line and beats the man at cover, diving to his right
full on middle and leg, clipped towards short midwicket
tossed up, a bit of drift in towards middle stump, tucked away towards wide mid-on
goes on the back foot to a reasonably full ball on middle stump, looks to work it leg side. Doesn't turn too much and he gets a leading edge back to the bowler
down the track now, is quicker than he expected and he pokes it out into the covers
back of a length, worked away from outside off towards deep square leg
fired in flat, angling down leg, and he tucks it off his pads to square leg
back of a length, angling in towards middle stump. Faf shuffles across and works it towards short fine leg
length ball, a bit of width outside off. He comes forward and slaps it to short cover
shortish ball on middle stump, pulled away to deep square leg
length ball, drifting onto the pads, clipped down to long leg
down the track now, makes a bit of room and flays it away towards deep cover
onto the pads again, clipped away to long leg
floated up towards middle stump, clipped away through midwicket
length ball, angling in towards off stump. He stays beside the line and bunts it towards point
back of a length outside off, slashed away past point, who falls to his right and ends up diving over the ball
straighter now and he clips it into the on side
a touch short on off stump. He makes room to cut but can't get it past point
a bit slower, and he goes on the back foot and works it from off stump towards square leg
again, Watson drifts onto the pads, and again Faf picks up the easy single to long leg
down the track, makes room for the flat-batted slap through the off side, can't beat short cover

angled across, back of a length. It isn't short enough to pull and it goes under his bat, and goes over the top of the off bail. Wade can't collect cleanly and it bounces off his glove to the fine leg boundary
fuller now, on off stump, and he drives it out to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, worked off the back foot towards short midwicket
on the pads once more. This one looked like a legcutter. Straightened a touch and he couldn't get that flick away, edged it onto his pad
tossed up on off stump, driven firmly but Warner cuts it off at cover, diving to his left
length ball on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
down the track now, gets to the pitch and clips it from well outside off towards midwicket
down the leg side now and he tucks it away to deep backward square leg
fullish on middle stump, pushed down the ground to mid-on
angled in towards leg stump, flicked away through midwicket
length ball, a bit of width outside off. Beats short cover with his drive but can't beat mid-off to his right
on the pads once more, and this time Faf plays very late to glance it away to the fine leg boundary. Long leg had no chance of stopping that
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to forward square leg
full outside off, driven firmly back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched to long-off
length ball angling away outside off. Looked to lean back and cut and ended up slashing it down to third man

Maxwell strikes! It's a good ball, tossed up and angled in towards off stump. He looked to play it towards mid-on, with the angle, but didn't get to the pitch and closed his face too early. Leading edge pops back to Maxwell for the simplest of c&bs.
full and flat on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
a bit slower now, and he lets it come on and clips it away to the right of short midwicket
fullish on middle stump, clipped towards deep midwicket
goes on the back foot to a length ball on leg stump, works it away to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, and he uses his wrists to bring deep midwicket into play once more
length ball on middle stump. Shuffles across to tuck it away towards long leg
bouncer outside off. AB simply stands there and lets it go through to the keeper. Bounced comfortably over head height
shortish outside off, punched off the back foot to the right of point
back of a length outside off. He goes deep in his crease and dabs it away late to third man
gone! That was a good ball, rising uncomfortably from back of a length outside off, and he pokes at it while hopping across and gets an outside edge through to the keeper
length ball, angling across towards a fourth-stump line. Miller gets forward to defend into the covers
shorter now, down the leg side, and he can't connect with the glance
too straight again and he tucks it off his hips to long leg
angled in towards off stump. Miller presses forward to block it back to the bowler
a touch short and he jumps back quickly to slap it away to the point boundary
short again and this time it's straighter, so he opens up and pulls it to deep midwicket
fullish, angled across outside off. AB gets forward to block it back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
length ball outside off. Miller leaves it alone
length ball on off stump. De Villiers stays on the back foot and punches it down the ground, to the right of mid-off
length ball, angling across towards middle and off. Gets on his toes and tucks it towards midwicket
fuller now, on middle and off, clipped to short midwicket
length ball on leg stump, tucked off the pads to short midwicket
full, angling across outside off. Miller leaves it alone
fullish on middle stump, clipped away to deep square leg
full on off stump, defended with a straight bat towards mid-off
length ball on a fourth-stump line. He works it with the angle to mid-on
back of a length outside off, poked away towards point
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump. Gets his front foot across and works it past short midwicket but can't beat mid-on
back of a length, angling away. Looks to dab it away off the back foot, can't beat short third man
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards point
length ball on off stump, worked away wristily to the left of mid-on
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, dabbed down towards short third man
short ball angled into the body, half-pulled, half-flicked to the man at long leg
bouncer now and Miller ducks safely under it
dug in once more and he goes for the hook, doesn't connect and the ball passes narrowly over his gloves
lbw appeal as he's struck on the pad looking to work it through the leg side. Pretty full, but from that angle, it's likely it pitched outside leg
onto the pads and he clips it away to the left of the fielder at long leg
back of a length, a touch too straight once more, and he tucks it away to long leg again
shortish ball, angling in. Miller stays adjacent to the line and dabs it down to third man
full, on a fourth-stump line, and mid-off falls to his right to try and cut off the drive but AB's hit that incredibly hard and there's no way he's stopping that, even though he got both hands to it
a touch shorter now and he goes on the back foot to punch it towards mid-off
slower ball, fairly full on off and middle, and he pokes that away towards point
slower ball angling away from off stump. AB waits an eternity and dabs it away towards third man
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
fullish, slanted across towards off stump, steered to sweeper cover
on the pads now and he clips it away to long leg
on leg stump and it's tucked down to deep backward square leg
looks for the yorker, it's a touch too leg-side and he clips it down to long leg
another of those slower balls, angling in towards off stump. Miller comes forward to defend into the covers
goes on the back foot now, but the ball doesn't come on. Seemed to want to punch through the off side. Ends up blocking it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, driven on the up to the left of the diving short extra cover fielder
length ball on off stump, pushed to short extra cover
a little fuller and wider, steered away to sweeper cover
back of a length, angling away outside off, and he shuffles across to try and work it into the leg side. The bowler moves quickly in his follow-through to cut off the single
back of a length, a bit of width outside off. He leans back and plays a very late dab to third man
short outside off, Miller opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
shortish outside off, and he takes a huge step back and across and whips it with a lot of bottom hand, and Bailey does very well at mid-on to move swiftly to his right and dive to stop the ball
this time he skips entirely outside off and clips the full ball towards deep midwicket
shortish ball, doesn't rise too much, and he whips it off his hip to long leg
length ball on off stump. He stays on the back foot and shows it the full face to punch it to mid-off
length ball on off stump. Miller gets a big stride out to push that down to mid-off
down the leg side and AB can't quite connect with the glance. Off his pad towards square leg
slower ball outside off. Ge lets it comne on and dabs it to short third man
in the blockhole on leg stump, clipped away to deep backward square leg
fullish outside off, driven down to long-off
slower ball on middle and off, punched back to the bowler
fullish outside off, AB plays a checked drive to sweeper cover
length ball on middle and off, worked away to deep midwicket
angling across towards off stump, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, punched to short cover
shortish ball, doesn't come on at all as he goes for the pull. Bottom-edges it down into the pitch
a length ball outside off, driven on the up from the crease towards long off
good length around off stump, defended on the front foot towards the off side
Miller moves forward to a fuller ball around off and square drives through cover point to bring up the 50 partnership
defended on the front foot on the off side
AB opens the face as he drives through point
good length on middle and off, Miller presses forward and pushes the ball towards mid-on for a single
Miller moves across and works a length ball off his pads through square leg
AB uses the room outside off to drive the ball through cover point
defended from the crease towards mid-on
banged in short, AB waits for it and plays a short-arm pull behind square, just paddled it down really
glanced off the pads for a single to fine leg
steps out of his crease and drives a length delivery to long off

nicely done. It's full on a fourth-stump line and he gets out the reverse-lap, deflects it just wide of the keeper's gloves and Bailey has a lot of work to do, running back from short third man and putting in the slide at the boundary
back of a length on off stump, punched towards point
tossed up on off stump, driven down to long-on
sweeps now, from middle stump down to deep square leg
fullish on the pads, clipped away towards deep square leg
flat and quick outside off and he comes forward to block it back to the bowler
length ball down the leg side. Goes deep in his crease and tucks it away towards deep square leg
full-toss wide outside off and AB says thank you and drives it away to the cover boundary. Full, flowing follow-through, beats the sweeper running to his right
full outside off and he drives it through the same area, to the left of short extra cover and to the right of the sweeper cover
full outside off, driven down to long-off
full on off stump, punched down the ground, off the bowler's hands to short extra cover
full outside off, driven down to long-off
shortish outside off, slapped away to deep point
slanted down leg, and he can't get the flick away, hits him on the pad
back of a length, goes with the arm towards middle and off. Goes deep in his crease to punch it to mid-on
quickish ball on middle and leg, blocked towards short midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-on
full, angled in towards middle and off. Defended towards short cover
sweeps, knew what he was doing. Fine leg was up in the circle and he took it from an off-and-middle line, bottom hand coming off, and beat the fielder easily, to his left
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
floated across outside off, clipped wristily back to the bowler
a bit quicker and flatter and he blocks it towards short cover
big appeal for lbw as he misses the sweep. Not given, and are they reviewing? Nah. Ooh. That pitched middle and leg and straightened. Not sure about the height
full on middle and leg, clipped towards deep square leg
goes back to a length ball that goes with the angle, and has to make room to punch that to short cover
a bit more flight outside off and he drives it to sweeper cover for a single
back of a length, goes with the angle as he looks to push it into the covers and he gets a thick outside edge towards third man
shortish outside off, slapped away to the right of sweeper cover
slow, a bit fuller outside off, and he comes forward and opens his bat face to drive towards deep point
slides this down the leg side and Miller sweeps with a powerful downswing to send it racing away to the backward square leg boundary
full-toss, and that is punished. Lashed away to the deep point boundary after he made a bit of room
another low full-toss, driven down to long-off
full on middle and off. Stays adjacent to the line and drives it down to long-off
slants this in towards leg stump and AB clips it to short midwicket
goes on the back foot now, looked like it might have been the wrong 'un. Adjusts his feet and works it away to deep midwicket

shortish outside off and that is an excellent shot. Just went back, made a bit of room, and eased it past short cover. Slowed down as it neared the boundary but the fielder had a long way to chase and the batsmen ran four
back of a length on middle and off. AB hops across and tucks it towards short midwicket
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. AB leans away from the line to make some room but can't beat backward point with his punch
fuller now, angling in towards off stump. AB had already moved across his crease, and simply waited for it to come on before whipping it away into the gap to the left of deep midwicket
short, down the leg side, and that's a gimme. AB doesn't connect cleanly with the pull but gets enough bat on it to get it away from Wade, who throws himself horizontally to his left
shortish, pulled away from an off-stump line down to deep midwicket

short again, and Miller swivels around and makes such sweet contact with the ball that Faulkner at deep square leg, who didn't have too much distance to cover to his left, had no way of cutting it off despite putting in a desperate dive
shortish, a lot of width outside off, but that's the sort of ball that sweeper cover is there to mop up. AB slaps it straight to him, and they only get a single
back of a length, angling in towards off stump and cramping him for room a bit. Dabs it down towards short cover
slower ball, slides it down leg. Miller can't connect cleanly with the flick, gets a bit of a tickle onto his pad down to the right of the keeper
another slower ball on leg stump, another tickle backward of square on the leg side, different batsman

gone. It was fullish, wide outside off, looked like another slower ball, and Miller went after it but was too early into his shot. Scooped it straight up and straight down the throat of Smith at cover
length ball on off stump, punched towards mid-off
goes back to a length ball angling in towards off stump, clips it to mid-on with a lot of bottom hand
full, on middle and off, punched down to mid-on

back of a length, a bit of extra bounce and maybe it straightened too. Behardien looked to work it with the angle, closed his face on it and got a thick outside edge that ran away very fine to the third man boundary
fuller now, and he clips it to mid-on and sets off immediately for the single
looks to cramp him for room, overdoes the angle, and slides it down the leg side
short ball, angling in and tucking AB up. He leans away from the line and gets on top of the bounce to dab it down to point

full on off stump and that is a gorgeous shot. Simply showed it the full face and punched through the line. The umpire skipped hurriedly out of the way and the ball raced away to the straight boundary
back of a length outside off, and he opens his bat face to steer it to the right of third man
length ball on the pads and he clips it to the left of short midwicket, who gets a hand to it on the dive but can't quite stop it from squeezing past him
bouncer, and Behardien ducks under it, looking a little ungainly
short ball, rising to shoulder height, pulled down to deep square leg
back of a length, angling towards middle stump. AB goes on the back foot and punches it towards short extra cover
shortish slower ball, pulled down to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling into the body. AB leans away from it and chops it down towards point
shuffles across even before the bowler had released, and works it from outside off towards midwicket
in the blockhole on middle and leg, jabbed back to the bowler. Good ball.
shortish, angling in towards off. AB looks for the cut, doesn't have too much room, hits it straight to point
another yorker, on leg stump, and he has to lift his foot away in a hurry to dig that out towards short midwicket. Excellent delivery, 146.7kph
slower short ball, AB waits for it and pulls it to deep midwicket
back of a length on leg stump. Good, tight line, and he makes room but can only punch it as far as mid-off
fuller now, on leg stump again, punched straight back to the bowler
slower ball angling across towards off stump, nurdled to the right of short midwicket
short ball, pulled to deep midwicket
full on leg stump, clipped to mid-on
slower ball, out of the back of the hand. Almost in the blockhole on leg stump and it's clipped to the man at short midwicket
full on middle stump. AB makes room and drives to the right of sweeper cover
AB tries to make room and Starc follows him with the bouncer. He leans away and lets it pass through to the keeper
length ball, angling in towards off stump. AB makes room and drives inside out to cover
looks for the yorker, and Behardien looks to flick. Can't connect, gets a bit of foot on to it through to the keeper
short ball, and he can't get the pull past short midwicket
AB moves outside leg stump, looks to make room again, and Starc darts it in full, aiming at his feet. Can't connect with the flick, hits his foot and runs away into the off side
back of a length outside off and that's nicely played. Moved away from the line and opened his bat face and dabbed it away to the right of the diving keeper

slower short ball and he pulls, not very far from short midwicket, and AB has to dive to complete the single. Would have been interesting had Bailey's throw hit the stumps. He'd have been out, in fact.
slower ball outside off. He waits on the back foot and punches it away towards cover
short, Behardien swivels to pull it round to long leg
another slower short ball, and that is exceptional from Bailey, diving full-length to his right at short midwicket to stop that well-struck pull from AB

slower ball does the trick! AB skips down the track now, and Cummins bowls the slower ball, shortening his length. AB looks to drag it from outside off and slog it over the top, and ends up scooping it straight into the hands of the man at deep midwicket, running in from the rope
short ball, and McLaren drops his wrists to let it pass outside off
slower ball, full on off stump, and he looks to punch it down the ground and gets an inside edge down to deep backward square leg
full on off stump, clipped with the angle past short midwicket. Mid-on runs to his right to do the fielding
back of a length on off stump. McLaren goes back and across to defend
slower ball, banged in halfway down the pitch, and he doesn't make a clean connection with the pull, rolls off the bottom edge towards square leg
on the pads, clipped away to the right of short midwicket
back of a length on a fourth-stump line. Hops across and dabs it to third man
fullish outside off, driven straight to short cover
full on leg stump and that's a super shot. Punches it down the ground, left-elbow high, and he holds his pose as it screams away between the bowler and mid-on
short now and he swivels into a crunching hook, gets it perfectly into the gap between square leg and long leg
bangs it in short, and it went over the top of leg stump as he shuffled across and ducked
short again, another powerful pull, this one goes straight to deep midwicket
full, tails in late towards middle stump. Gets his front foot out of the way and jabs it to short midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, and he looks to clip it away to the left of short midwicket but Bailey anticipates and moves swiftly to cut off the single
length ball wide outside off. Probably saw McLaren backing away to make room, and he had to reach out to drive and couldn't connect
in the blockhole on off stump, clipped away to deep square leg
got him! That was the slower bouncer again, and he was caught between trying to pull and trying to avoid the ball. Ended up getting a thin edge that looped into Wade's gloves
back of a length outside off, punched away towards point
full on middle and off, and he can't really make enough room to force that drive past short cover
full on leg stump, and it's worked away towards deep backward square leg
slower ball, fairly full outside off, and it completely flummoxed Peterson, who shaped to drive, then decided to try and dab it, and ended up pulling his bat away to leave the ball
another back-of-the-hand slower ball and Peterson is beaten again, this time playing down the wrong line as it straightened past off stump
a bit fuller and he gets a single with the checked drive to mid-off
lbw appeal as he misses the flick but the ball's definitely slanting down the leg side. Bounced off the front pad towards backward point
bouncer, angling into the body, and Behardien sways out of the way
in the blockhole on a fourth-stump line, jabbed away towards cover point
makes room and Starc follows him with the back-of-a-length ball. Looked to pull, could get no room to swing his arms and ended up dragging it feebly to short midwicket
full on off stump, and he clears his front leg and slogs it along the ground to long-on
full outside off, and he throws his bat at it and slices it uppishly down to third man. Excellent over to end an excellent spell from Starc
back of a length slower ball on middle and leg. Clears his front leg and clubs it down to long-on
slower ball outside off and he looks for the reverse-slap. Doesn't connect, misses by a long way
full on off stump and he clears his front leg and slogs it back over the bowler's head. Carries all the way over the boundary

gone! That was the slower ball, full and straight, and Peterson looked to slog it across the line, over the leg side. He was through his shot too quickly and the ball sneaked through and crashed into middle stump
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover

and another. This one's a run-out, Warner sends in a pinpoint direct hit from mid-off. Behardien drove this straight to the fielder. It was another slower ball, on leg stump, and he made room to play the drive but couldn't get it past Warner. Took his arm on and lost, by quite a distance. Gave up and simply hoped Warner would miss the stumps.
slower ball, back of a length. Steyn looks to back away and smash it down the ground, toe-ends it back to the bowler
another slower ball, this one's outside off. Steyn moves away from his stumps an d looks to slog it over midwicket. Doesn't connect.
another slower ball, another swing and miss. This one was straighter and it bounced over the top of the stumps before rolling down to the keeper
aaaaaaand again. Another huge slog that doesn't connect, and this time they sneak a bye as it rolls down to Wade
another slower ball. Down the leg side this time and Parnell can't connect with the glance. Gets some pad onto it, rolls down towards fine leg
slower ball to finish. It's a touch short on off stump and he pulls it away into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket to pick up two

inn2.comm: outswinger on a nice length outside off. Finch leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, steered to third man off the back foot
length ball, straightens towards middle stump. Warner goes on the back foot and defends towards short midwicket
back of a length, a touch straight, and he skips onto the back foot to work it off his hips towards square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length on off stump. Shuffles across and works it off his hips backward of square on the leg side
back of a length down the leg side. Warner can't get the flick away and it's off his thigh pad through to the keeper
a touch too straight again and he skips across to work it away through square leg
length ball outside off, a bit of shape away and Finch leaves it alone
a little fuller and closer to off stump. Finch gets forward to drive into the covers
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
onto the pads now and he clips it away to long leg
length ball, swinging away from a fourth-stump line. Finch leaves again
a bit shorter, a bit more width, and he punches it to short cover. Not quite off the middle of the bat
back of a length outside off, and he uses his wrists to get on top of the bounce and play it down the ground, back towards the bowler

lovely shot, excellent fielding, marred a bit by the throw. It was a length ball on off stump and he showed it the full face to punch it to the right of mid-off. Parnell dived to his right to stop it and then threw to the bowler's end unneccessarily to give away an overthrow

shout for caught behind, and it isn't given. South Africa are wondering whether to review, and Steyn asks the batsman if he hit it. As if he's going to say yes. It straightened outsode off, from back of a length, and he poked at it with no footwork. Looked like it missed his edge, good thing they didn't review
back of a length again, a bit closer to off, and he shuffles across to defend to short cover
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, and he jumps back and across to block into the off side

lbw appeal, and it's given. Abbott has struck with a beauty. Warner defended from the crease, playing down the wrong line. It straightened a touch from middle and leg, missed his inside edge and struck him on the back pad, in front of the stumps.
back of a length outside off, slapped away to the right of third man
another excellent delivery, back of a length outside off. Finch again pokes away from his body, his feet moving after his bat went, and the ball straightened and missed his outside edge.
this one's closer to off stump but the result is the same. Finch's feet are stuck and his hands are poking at everything.
this one's angled in a bit more and Finch can get behind it and punch solidly to short cover
length ball, angling in and straightening from a fourth-stump line. Watson leaves it alone
a bit of width this time and Watson gets his front foot across and drives on the up to the left of short cover
back of a length, closer to off stump, and he plays a backfoot defensive punch into the covers
full outside off, a touch overpitched with a decent amount of width, and Watson leans over the ball and rolls his wrists through a lovely drive that runs away to the squarish cover boundary
length ball, a bit closer to off stump, and he gets a big stride forward to drive to mid-off
straighter now, on middle stump, and he brings his bat around his front pad to work it towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, a bit of shape away, and he defends towards mid-off, jumping across into a squared-up position
fuller now, on off stump, and he punches it down the ground to the left of mid-on

there's that front pad of Watson's, thrust dangerously in front of his stumps. Abbott angled it in and bowled it fairly full, and his bat came down just in time and he squeezed it off the inside edge onto his pad towards short midwicket
fullish again, outside off, and he gets forward to defend down the pitch
fullish, angling in towards off stump, Watson gets a big stride out to punch to mid-off
length ball, angling in towards off stump. Watson presses forward and defends into the off side
length ball outside off, slapped away towards backward point
back of a length, angling in towards off and middle. Finch punches off the back foot to mid-off
fuller now, and McLaren gives him a bit of width outside off. He throws his bat at it and chips it over cover. Doesn't quite middle it and it stops well short of the rope
full again, even more width, and this time it's right off the sweet spot, a lovely, low, skimming hit over cover
back of a length now, angling in. Doesn't have enough room for the cut and he's beaten by the extra bounce

shortish, this time he does give him width. This is rubbish bowling from McLaren, and Finch waits on it and steers it away quite fine, third man has no chance of running to his left and cutting it off
length ball outside off, big stride out and defends into the covers
length ball outside off, looked like he bowled it with an offcutter action. Watson came forward and let it come on before chopping it down to third man

ooooh, that looked close. This one came in from outside off and caught Finch on the back pad, on the shuffle. Not given, and de Villiers doesn't review. Hit him on the flap of the pad, and Hawkeye says it's going over the stumps
again he's caught on the crease, on the shuffle, but he manages to squeeze it away into the off side. Lovely length from Abbott
this one's a little straighter and he shuffles across and squirts it down into the leg side
a little fuller now, on off stump. Finch is halfway forward to block it into the off side
back of a length, angling in towards middle and off. Looks to work it leg side, can't quite get hold of it and it drops down onto the pitch
short, wide, and he has to reach across but manages to get nicely on top of the bounce to cut it away in front of square
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Watson goes back and across to block to short cover
shortish, a bit of width, and he dabs it down to third man with an open bat face
angled into the pads this time and he goes on the back foot to work it wide of the diving short midwicket fielder
fullish, angling in from outside off. Watson stretched forward to drive, got a thickish inside edge into the leg side
length ball on the pads, clipped away towards deep backward square leg
shortish, stops on the batsman a bit as he shapes to pull. He has to wait a little before pulling it down towards deep square leg
on the pads once more and he gets away with it. Fine leg was in the circle but Watson's little clip was too close to the man
back of a length, angling across and he gets back and across to slap it away towards third man
back of a length on middle stump. Watson defends off the back foot towards mid-on
short, and Watson's pulled that away murderously but straight to the man at deep square leg
full, too straight, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off and he dabs it away to third man. Waits until it's almost passed him and then places an open-faced blade in front of the ball
shortish, a bit of width again, and Watson chops it down to third man
back of a length outside off and third man is made to work again as Finch waits for the ball to come to him and dabs it away quite fine

gone! He's bowled a lot of not very good balls, and one of them's gotten him a wicket. It was a wide half-volley, and he could have smashed that anywhere, but he ended up going flat-batted at it and got a top-edge through to the keeper
length ball, quite wide outside off, and Smith leaves it alone
on the pads and he dabs it away to the right of short midwicket with a more or less straight bat
full on middle stump, clipped to short midwicket
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Presses forward to block towards mid-off
bangs this in short and Smith shuffles across and ducks his shoulders to let it pass down the leg side
back of a length on off stump. Shuffles back and across to defend back to the bowler
shuffles across once again, defends this back of a length ball back to the bowler
a little fuller but he's still on the back foot to block that back to the bowler. On the back foot and in an extremely open position. Works for him, I suppose.
fullish on middle stump, punched to mid-on off a half-forward stride
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, dabbed down to third man
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, angled in towards off stump, and he shuffles across to work it to short midwicket
full and wide and he gets down nice and low to drive it to the sweeper on the cover boundary
length ball on off stump, punched down the ground to mid-on

back of a length outside off, and he doesn't quite get across as he tries to punch. Ends up chopping it back down the pitch off the inside edge. They set off for a single, and Finch could have been run out at the batsman's end had Parnell connected with that kick he aimed at the ball in his follow-through
got him! It's a short ball and Finch has pulled it uppishly, straight down the throat of the man at deep square leg
lovely delivery. It's the slower one, angled across the stumps, and it beats Bailey's outside edge as he pushes half forward and pokes uncertainly at the ball
back of a length on middle stump, and he hops across to defend towards short midwicket
aaand again. This one's slanted across once more, a touch wider this time, and Bailey's front foot is barely out of his crease as he prods away from his body
short ball, sits up a little, and he pulls it away but can't get more than a single as Behardien dives acrobatically to his right at short midwicket and gets a meaty hand in the way of the ball
short and wide to start and he slaps it away to the left of the man at deep point
short and wide once more, and this time he hits it straight to the sweeper
down the track and Peterson pulls his length back a touch, angling it into the batsman. Smith blocks it back to the bowler
a bit of width but it isn't short enough to cut, sneaks under Smith's bat
down the track again and he heaves it over midwicket. Doesn't get hold of it and comes off looking ungainly, but his score has moved along by two runs
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of cover
back of a length, angling across to off stump, and he steps back and across to block towards short extra cover
down the leg side now and Smith politely moves his bat and body out of the way
back of a length on off stump, defended down the ground to mid-off
a touch wider this time and he shuffles across, lets it come on, and dabs it with soft hands into the covers
short now and he pulls it away to the man at deep forward square leg/squarish deep midwicket (I'm never sure what to call that position)
shortish, doesn't quite get up, and he pulls it round from about hip height down to long leg
full now, angling towards off stump, and he takes a half step forward to block it
back of a length, angled in towards middle stump, defended off the back foot into the covers
back of a length again, outside off this time, punched to sweeper cover
once again it's back of a length, and this time it's Bailey who punches to the man sweeping up on the off-side boundary
goes back to a length ball and it skids through with the angle. Hurriedly jams his bat down and gets an inside edge into the on side
goes deep in his crease and works this from outside off down to long-on. He's a touch too short here.
fuller now, on middle stump, and he drives this down to long-on
short ball and that is very well played. Goes back and across and fetches it from wide outside off and rolls his wrists over to beat mid-on running to his right
back of a length over middle stump. Smith stands tall and punches it into the covers
length ball outside off and he presses forward and opens his bat face to place the ball between point and cover
back of a length on middle stump. Bailey hops across and works it towards short midwicket
length ball on a fourth-stump line, he leans over it and steers it to third man
shuffles across again, works it off his hips to long leg
down the track and he plays for more turn than is available, gets an inside edge that runs away into the leg side
down the track again, pushed down to mid-on
quicker and flatter, and he goes on the back foot to defend. Playing the trajectory rather than the length
a bit slower and he defends this into the on side
quicker once more, on off stump, and he blocks it into the covers from halfway forward
gentle full ball outside off, driven to sweeper cover
not quite as full as Smith pushes forward to drive through cover, and he ends up inside-edging it into the leg side
length ball, angling in towards middle stump, blocked towards short midwicket
slower ball, bowled with a legcutter action, on off stump, and he drives it down the ground to long-on
back of a length outside off and he punches it back down the ground, forcing Behardien to tumble to his left in his follow-through to stop the ball
fuller now and he gets forward to drive to the right of sweeper cover
shortish, a touch of width, cracked away to the right of sweeper cover
once again a bit of width and Bailey slaps it to sweeper cover
fuller now and he comes forward and opens his bat face to run it down to third man
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Bailey defends back to the bowler, playing from the crease
back of a length on middle stump and he shuffles across to work it into the on side
back of a length outside off and he shuffles across to punch to mid-off
back of a length on off stump. Goes back and across to work it towards midwicket
another leg-roller on a fullish length outside off, dabbed away to short third man and Smith takes off in a flash from the non-striker's end
full outside off, driven to long-off
full on off stump, punched back to the bowler
slower ball on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
full on middle stump, worked away to the right of short midwicket
full outside off. Gets a decent stride out to defend into the covers
slants down the leg side again and he misses the flick but could have picked up a lot of leg byes had de Kock not moved quickly to his left and stopped the ball one-handed
gone! That was short and not massively wide and he flashed at it with no footwork. A bit of extra bounce and he gets a thick outside edge through to de Kock

back of a length on middle stump. Jumps back and across and defends with soft hands to the right of short midwicket. That was enough to break his bat at the junction of blade and handle. Wow. It's broken in two right at the top of the splice.
back of a length outside off and he punches it away to the left of point and the right of third man
back of a length outside off, a little fuller than the previous one. Smith leaves it alone
full, angling in towards middle stump, and he punches it down the ground towards mid-on
back of a length, angling in towards leg stump. Shuffles across and tucks it away towards fine leg
back of a length on middle stump, defended towards short midwicket
full, angling down the leg side, and he can't connect with the flick, gets a leg bye down to square leg
a touch too straight and he skips across his crease and glances that extremely fine. Poor bowling
back of a length outside off and he steers it away to the right of third man

got 'im! That was angled in, that straightens off the pitch, and Maxwell makes the same mistake that Bailey made. No. Footwork. Whatsoever. Pushes hard at it and the ball takes his outside edge and first slip takes the simplest of catches. Steyn bowled that cross-seam.
full outside off and that is the most footwork we have seen for a while. Confident stride forward to drive towards the cover boundary
length ball, angling across towards off stump. Wade gets behind the line and defends back towards the bowler
length ball on off stump again and he lets it come on and dabs it into the off side
back of a length on middle stump. Wade shuffles across and helps it along towards long leg
fullish outside off, defended into the covers
shortish outside off, and he gets on his toes to punch it away into the covers. Looked a little Ganguly-esque but mistimed
short outside off, not too much width, slapped away towards point
fullish and wide outside off. Smith leaves it alone
down the track and McLaren follows him, tucks him up for room. Smith is forced to block it back to the bowler
goes for the pull but it isn't quite short enough. Hits him on the back leg and runs away backward of point
length ball, angling away from Wade. He gets his head over the ball and defends into the off side
and he starts with a short, wide ball. The sort of ball that sweeper cover was invented to mop up behind
back of a length outside off, punched away wide of short cover
down the track now, and he has to stretch a little to defend that into the off side
full on off stump and he moves his front leg out of the way and squeezes it away in the gap between point and short third man
fullish outside off, driven down to long-off
tossed up outside off, comes forward and dabs it towards backward point
short ball, and Smith goes back and across and swivels to pull it round to long leg
angled in towards a fourth-stump line and Wade gets nicely forward to drive that to sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump. Smith shuffles across and works it to deep square leg
slower ball, angled in towards off stump. Wade gets his head over the ball and dabs it with soft hands towards point
back of a length outside off, punched to cover point
shuffles across once more and meets the ball outside off and clips it away towards deep midwicket
fullish, angled in towards middle and leg, and he goes back to clip that to square leg
full on middle stump, driven down to long-off
back of a length, turns in towards middle stump, defended with the spin towards short midwicket
now he comes forward to sweep from outside off, towards short fne leg
down the track now, doesn't quite get hold of the big shot, hits it all along the ground ot long-on
down the track again, whipped from outside off to short midwicket
length ball, angling into the pads, tucked away to long leg
short, not too much width, he leans away from the line and slashes it over the top of the finer of two catching men behind square, bounces short of third man
short ball, doesn't quite come on, and he pulls it round to long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended towards short extra cover
a touch short, a bit of width, not enough for Wade to be able to force it past Amla and backward backward point. [There's also a forward backward point]
fuller now, on a fourth-stump line. Wade comes forward to defend into the covers
steps out of his crease to get to the pitch of the ball and drives to long on for a single
Wade steps out this time but he isn't to the pitch of the ball, has to defend in the end
stays in his crease and nudges the ball towards midwicket gently for a quick single
Smith plants his front foot well outside off to open up the area behind square and swats the ball into the gap in that area, McLaren covers a lot of ground and makes a diving save at long leg
played into the cover region for a single
pushed towards long on for a single
Smith swivels towards the off side and pulls the short ball down behind square leg to move on to 49
Wade plays a crisp drive through covers to turn the strike over
Smith gets to his 50 off 63 balls by dabbing a short of a length delivery towards third man, his second 50 in a row. He can't be kept out of the ODI side anymore, surely?
pushed towards wicket for a single
Smith played the pull too early and ended up toe-ending the ball back to the bowler
what sort of a shot is that? Smith backs away outside leg to a short ball and tennis-smashes it over the head of the fielder mid-off. Ugly, ungainly, unorthodox, but it got the job done.
Wade backs away outside leg to make room and drills the ball hard through extra cover, consecutive boundaries for Australia
gets down on one knee now and slog sweeps to deep midwicket
played to long off for a single
nudged to midwicket but they decide against the single

played with soft hands through covers and they are taking on the fielder running in from the deep for a risky second, Wade dives full stretch as de Kock breaks the stumps. He's safe. Superb running and diving
spins into the left-hander, punched off the back foot to the off side
back of a length on middle stump. Smith shuffles across and clips it to long leg

length ball on off stump. Wade clips it towards mid-on and immediately calls Smith through for a risky-looking single. Oh yes. McLaren's throw went over the stumps at the bowler's end. Had he hit, it was bye, bye, Wade.
too straight and he works it off his hips towards long leg
shuffles a couple of steps down the pitch. Parnell shortens his length a touch and he has to block it into the covers
short ball, pulled down to deep backward square leg
into the blockhole on middle and leg. Clipped carefully to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, chopped down to sweeper cover
slower ball on the pads and he gets away with it. Clipped straight to short fine leg
short and wide and that is excellent fielding from Parnell. Smith looked to open his bat face and steer it away to the right of short third man but he was alert and he dived across to make the stop
back of a length, angled across, chopped down to short third man
angled across towards off stump. Looks to make room and find the gap between point and short third man, picks out the point fielder
looks to go fuller, ends up sliding down the leg side
shortish, a bit of width, slapped to the right of the off-side sweeper
fullish outside off, driven to sweeper cover
nearly played on! He moved away from his stumps to make room and Abbott followed him with the back of a length ball. He inside-edged it onto his pads and it nearly trickled onto his stumps
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and tucks it away to the right of the long leg fielder
short ball, sits up, and he pulls it down to deep midwicket
looks to work this from outside off, against the angle, and doesn't connect. Runs off his back pad towards the keeper
back of a length, angled across, bunted towards short cover
fullish on off stump and Smith clears his front leg and slogs it away over midwicket. Doesn't quite get hold of it but he picks out a vacant area and picks up four for his efforts
back of a length outside off and he opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
full outside off, gets nicely forward and drives to short cover
down the track and bang. That was angled across and he shovels it over midwicket with a short-arm batswing. Take that!
length ball angling towards off stump, and he clears his front leg and dabs it to backward point
super work from de Kock. It was slanting away and he slashed hard at it. The thick inside edge could have easily run away for four but the keeper threw himself to his left to stop the ball one-gloved
back of a length on middle stump, shuffles across and tucks it away towards fine leg
down the track and he shortens his length a bit. Slogs it away down to mid-on
down the track, makes a lot of room. Parnell follows him and he looks to slog. Bat turns in his hands and it rolls down to mid-on
shuffles across again, and works it from off stump down to long leg
low full-toss wide outside off. Wade reaches out but can't get bat to ball
shortish, a bit of width outside off, and that's nicely done by Wade, opens up to make some room and slaps it over short cover, wide of mid-off, with a lot of bottom hand
length ball outside off, Smith looks to work it into the leg side and gets a leading edge into the covers
shortish, just a bit of width and Wade pounces to smack that away between point and cover
down the track and he makes good contact with that flat-batted drive but it's too close to short cover to fetch him any runs
walks across his stumps and clips it from middle stump down to long leg, where Parnell dives and fumbles to give away a boundary
back of a length outside off. He looks to dab it away to third man and almost edges it to the keeper. A bit of extra bounce and he was lucky to get beaten
full outside off, and he opens his bat face to slice it down to third man
back of a length outside off. Smith goes back and across and bunts it into the off side, to the left of short cover
down the track and Abbott bangs it in a touch shorter. Opens up and slugs it away towards mid-on
backs away from leg stump and Abbott bowls a smart ball, full and outside off, just inside the tramline. Smith could do nothing but leave it alone
back of a length outside off. Shuffles across and pokes it down the ground, towards mid-on
yorker on off stump, dug out towards short cover. Excellent control here.
another yorker, on leg stump this time, and he gets his foot out of the way and jabs it away into the off side
length ball, angling in towards middle and off, clipped away to long leg

short ball and Wade has pulled that away and made very good contact. Deep square leg completely misjudged it. It was du Plessis. He came a few steps forward, then realised Wade has hit it much harder than he thought, and tries to dive backwards and take the catch but can't get anywhere near it
down the track, looked to mow the shortish ball over the leg side, was beaten. Shout from the keeper for caught behind, and Snicko does show a tiny little spike, but can't say if that was bat on ball
back of a length on off stump, dabbed away towards backward point
full-toss wide outside off, and that nearly ran away for four wides. De Kock must have stretched a couple of muscles to breaking point in diving across to his right to stop that
fullish on off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler, who makes a diving stop in his follow-through
back of a length outside off, dabbed away towards short third man
full on off stump. Smith goes back and across and clips it towards short midwicket
slower ball outside off. Throws his hands at it without moving his feet, and he's beaten
goes deep in his crease and Steyn looks for the yorker. Ends up bowling a leg-stump full-toss and he gets a little tickle on it and it runs away to the fine leg boundary
short outside off, Smith plays a checked short-arm pull to short midwicket
slower bouncer outside off and Smith can't decide between playing and leaving and in the end goes with the second option
fullish outside off and he slogs it down to mid-on
middle-stump yorker, and Smith moves his feet out of the way and jabs it back to the bowler
short ball and he swivels around to pull that to the man at deep midwicket

shortish outside off, and that is a sensational shot from Wade. Opens up, makes a bit of room, and clubs it down the ground, over the gap between the bowler and mid-off, and the ball carries all the way over the rope
full and wide now and Wade has to reach for it. Can't connect, and the umpire signals wide. Slightly harsh call, but they've generally been consistently harsh
excellent yorker again, on leg stump, and all he can do is block it back to the bowler after pulling his feet hurriedly out of the way

full and wide again and this time he manages to flat-bat it to the man at deep cover. Fifty up for Wade. Excellent innings from him. Started slowly but he's quickly upped the rate and reached the landmark in 55 balls.
in the blockhole on off stump and he slogs wildly and the bottom edge runs away past the man at short fine leg. Deep square leg runs around to stop it
oh, my. It was the slower one, angled in, and he slogged and missed. Rolled down to the keeper, and for once de Kock couldn't stop it, got up a little too quickly, and it ran away under his gloves.
low full-toss outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
whoopsie, that isn't a very good ball. It's a low full-toss on middle and leg and Smith shuffles across and clips it away to the fine leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and works it towards square leg
There's that Smith tennis smash. It was the bouncer and he hit it from above shoulder height, and just about cleared the bowler

another twist. It's another bouncer, and Wade goes for the hook, fetching it from over his left shoulder, was never in control, and McLaren runs in from the long leg boundary and slides forward to take the catch nice and low
full-toss on off stump and he's clipped it down to deep square leg. No-ball as well, and the umpire signals for the free hit
in the blockhole on leg stump. Looks to clear his front leg and slog it over the leg side, gets a thick inside edge down to the fine leg boundary
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
shuffles across. Parnell bowls it short and he pulls it round to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, and he opens his face to pick up another single to third man
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
very full outside off and he opens his bat face and squeezes it out to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, punched back down the ground and the bowler gets a hand to it to prevent the single
yorker on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
in the blockhole on middle stump, pushed down to mid-off for the single
full on middle and leg, flicked towards deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, dabbed away to third man

full outside off and Smith takes on the fielder after driving to the right of Peterson at short extra cover. He flicks at the stumps and misses, and Smith dives to regain his crease. Peterson is left-handed but he managed to underarm it right-handed
shortish slower ball outside off and he plays and misses. de Kock misjudges the bounce behind the stumps and they sneak a quick bye. Steyn, needless to say, is livid
and that's his hundred. Ungainly way to get it, a mistimed pull that rolls away towards square leg, but what an innings this has been. Australia were sinking without a trace when he began
short ball, sits up, and Faulkner clubs it away to the midwicket boundary. Poor ball, and it was severely dealt with
length ball on off stump and he clears his front leg and launches it back over the bowler, clean, flat hit, bounces over the long-on boundary

full on off stump, and he makes a little bit of room and punches it away to the left of cover. Behardien chases back and throws to the bowler's end. They take him on and Smith wins the race, getting to the crease before Abbott can reach in front of the stumps and collect the throw
middle-stump yorker, swiped down the ground to mid-on. Thought about going for the single for the misfield, turned around in the end and slid to beat the throw home to the keeper's end.
full-toss on leg stump and Faulkner clears his front leg and mows it over wide mid-on. Really poor ball, that. That was a baseball hit
wide yorker. Looks to back away and slap it through the off side. Is too early into the shot and drags it back to the bowler
back of a length on middle and leg, swatted away down to long leg
boom! That was short, and that is a familiar sight by now. Left leg moves away to make room. Arms swing through free and unfettered, ball disappears to the leg-side boundary.
down the track, hits it hard down to long-on
what happened there? Went for the big hit over the leg side, and it hit his thigh and was rolling towards the stumps, but he reached behind him and tapped the ball away
fired flat and full, but also wide outside off
down the leg side now and Faulkner sweeps, and hits it nice and clean, down to the deep backward square leg boundary
goes back to a length ball on off stump, makes room to punch it to sweeper cover

gone! That was tossed up nice and slow and Smith went for the big heave over the leg side. Was through his shot extremely early and the ball crashes into middle stump. Walks in to a standing ovation from the small crowd here

what a catch that is! Or is it? He came down the track and looked to slog it over mid-on. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball and didn't middle it. Went in the air to the right of mid-on, and Miller threw himself horizontally and came away with the ball in his right hand and a look of disbelief on his face. They aren't sure he took it on the full, and they're checking now. Yeah, it's bounced, and Australia have won, because the batsmen crossed. They looked dead and buried when Wade joined Smith, but they've ended up winning with an over to spare.
